Patch Set 35:

(1 comment)
Right, the order doesn't matter, output will be sorted.
Why on the slot ? If this is correct, please explain why in the commit msg.
Done
Huh? Why are you putting this on the slot? But getting this from the Device?

The Redfish PCIeDevice schema includes a Location property under the Slot object. At first, this seemed odd, but testing I realized that both the PCIeSlot and PCIeDevice interfaces provide the same location information. Currently, downstream code retrieves the Location property using the PCIeDevice interface, but it can also be accessed via the PCIeSlot interface.

I see it now. There is no Location under the PCIe Device root, only under the slot complex. :/ 
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/PCIeDevice.v1_11_0.json

Be careful talking about downstream forks.

Why wouldn't we go to the Slot Inventory Item for this information, since it is on the slot complex? In the future, if someone needs the location information for the device, that could be added to Redfish and fetched like it is here. 

It sounds like we don't need both (you mentioned they were the same) and only 1 is okay? Anyone else need both? I can open an issue with Redfish if so.
Changed the code to get Location from Slot.

If we continue in this direction, can you expand on this? This is unexpected.  E.g. 

The Redfish PCIeDevice schema includes a Location property under Slot since one doesn't exist on the PCIe Device root object.... This commit fetches the Location information from the PCIeDevice interface though..
Changed the code to get Location from PCIeSlot.
I meant at the L285 - L310
It should fail if either the getAllProperties or LocationCode of the PCIeSlot fails, just like any other PCIeDevice properties.

Add a space before `ec.value()`.

```
BMCWEB_LOG_ERROR << "DBUS response error for Location " << ec.value();
```
Done

I think it may be better to name to indicate something related to 'slot' here like
```
afterPCIeSlotGetDbusObject()
```
Not related to this commit.
I meant - the function name `afterGetDbusObject()` seems too generic, and it may name it like `afterPCIeSlotGetDbusObject()`.
I understand, but I didn't add this function in this commit.
Ack
#include <memory>
Done
#include <string>
Done
#include <boost/system/error_code.hpp>
Done
Do you mean this as `afterGetValidPCIeSlotPath()`?
Ack, not related to this commit.
